title: Are prior published papers crucial to getting admitted to a Ph.D. in psychology in the USA? - Quora
tags: Colleges and Universities in the United States of America

response.answer_text: It is not “crucial” that applicants to a U.S. PhD program in psychology have already published an article, especially if the applicant is just completing a baccalaureate degree, but it might help in certain circumstances (e.g., if the program has a lot of otherwise qualified applicants). What is crucial, aside from good grades and GRE scores, is the “fit” between what the applicant wants to accomplish and what the program has to offer.
